intro: Thlaspi angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf pennycress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, stream banks, and roadsides. It has small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are narrow and alternate along the stem. The plant is also known for its ability to accumulate heavy metals, making it useful in phytoremediation efforts.
